Description: Lower body and foot sherd of Corinthian, possibly black-glazed, pottery kotyle; interior: possible traces of black glaze; exterior: five rays (and parts of two more) rising from narrow band above foot; foot and underside worn; most of black is lost, only traces remain.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.240) (phase 3)
